title: Chronicles: Temple, Kings, and Hope
objective: Deepen biblical-theological understanding of chronicles: temple, kings, and hope and its place in redemptive history.

required_passages.text: Selected key passages for this unit segment, read in full during lesson delivery.

segments.audio_script: Today we study chronicles: temple, kings, and hope and trace God's covenant faithfulness.
Listen to the assigned passage and note covenant themes, divine actions, and human response.
We place this text in its historical setting, canonical location, and literary flow.
We analyze theological meaning, covenant development, and connections to the wider biblical story.
Key themes include God's holiness, covenant faithfulness, judgment and mercy, and redemptive purpose.
Reflect: what does this text reveal about God, humanity, and faithful obedience today?

Carry this lesson into prayer, worship, and careful Scripture reading as we continue the course. Canonical integration for this unit also includes 1 Chronicles, 2 Chronicles, Esther, Job, Proverbs, Ecclesiastes, Song of Solomon, Isaiah, Lamentations, Daniel, Hosea, Joel, Obadiah, Jonah, Nahum, Habakkuk, Zephaniah, Haggai, and Zechariah.
